intro: Collinsonia glandulosa, commonly known as the stickyweed or glandular collinsonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial with a distinctive appearance, featuring hairy, glandular stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
